IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: E-18 in-car camera operable: BODY CAMERA: partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1" style="color:#0563c1; text-decoration:underline">https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=87611b1f1f3d4fec9e12445488ab4877partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 FRONT VEHICLE CAMERA: https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=aa3accd8d4e348918504ff9121ca3622partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 Weather: Foggy and 72 degrees Defendant: Paulino Osorio Tejeda Date of Birth: 5/12/1983 Date of Arrest: 8/5/2023 Time of Arrest: 0244 hours License#: N/A DUI #: 23-54-155 DUI Citation #: 94D0DLX Subsequent Offender: No Accident Involved: No CERTIFICATES AND TRAINING: * I am trained to administer standardized field sobriety tests through the Maryland State Police and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. * Distinguished graduate of the University of Marylands DUI Institute. * Standardized Field Sobriety Instructor * Apprehended more than 370 impaired drivers during my tenure as a Law Enforcement Officer in 12 years. Phase #1 - Vehicle In Motion: On 8/5/2023 at approximately 0221 hours I, Senior Trooper Monk, was on a traffic stop at Carrolton Avenue and Margaret Street in Wicomico County, Maryland. During the traffic stop a white Chevrolet Terrain pulled in front of my patrol vehicle. The arrested person in my custody advised it was his translator. Cpl. Bean made contact with the translator and as he walked up to the vehicle the driver of the Terrain jumped into the back seat o the vehicle. The vehicle was displaying Maryland registration 8FB6158. Phase #2 - Personal Contact: I exited my vehicle and I contacted the driver of the vehicle. Who was later identified as PAULINO OSORIO TEJADA (H/M 5/12/1983). I was speaking with Osorio Tejeda outside of his car and I immediately observe there was a language barrier, and I detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage coming from his breath and person. I asked Osorio Tejada if had anything drink and he stated two drinks. I asked him if he was driving the vehicle and he motioned he was driving and pointed at the vehicle. Phase #3 - Pre Arrest Screening: I then began Standardized Field Sobriety Tests and I started with the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus Test. Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus Osorio Tejada had troubling following the stimulus. The test was not completed. Walk and Turn: Weather: Dry Surface: Level asphalt free of debris I instructed Osorio Tejada into the instructional phase. I began to explain and demonstrate the Walk and Turn test to Osorio Tejada. Osorio Tejada started before instructed to do so once. Osorio Tejada fell off balance once. He then began the test. Instructional Phase: Cannot keep balance Started before instructed to do so Walking stage 1st 9: Took 8 steps Turn: Picked up his lead foot to turn around Walking stage 2nd 9: Took 8 steps Total Walk and Turn Clues:4 of 8 One Leg Stand: I next explained and demonstrated the One Leg Stand test to Osorio Tejada. Osorio Tejada picked up his left foot and began. Seconds 1-10: Put Foot Down He stopped the test after 10 Total One Leg Stand Clues:1 of 4 Preliminary Breath Test: Unable to provide a breath sample Arrest and Transport: Based on the following, I had reason to believe Osorio Tejada was driving a motor vehicle under the influence: * Eyes unusually glassy * Admission to consuming alcoholic beverages prior to the stop * Got out of the driver seat into the back seat * Strong odor of an alcoholic beverage coming from his breath and person * My observed signs of impairment as he performed standard field sobriety tests At 0244 hours I placed Osorio Tejada under arrest for driving under the influence of alcohol. Osorio Tejada was placed in the front seat of Tfc. Huntingtons patrol vehicle. Upon getting inside the vehicle Tfc. Huntington detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage inside the vehicle that was not present prior to placing Osorio Tejada inside his vehicle. The audio version of the MVA DR-15 Spanish was played for Osorio Tejada, and he was giving a hard copy to read at the barrack. Osorio Tejada elected to refuse the intoximeter test and signed the Dr-15 at 0330 hours. Osorio Tejada was released to a sober driver and issued the proper citations. It should be noted Osorio Tejada was polite and cooperative throughout the encounter. It appeared Osorio Tejada took this situation seriously. Case closed by arrest. All events did occur in Wicomico County, Maryland.
